website_summaries.verdict: This hugely versatile pizza oven can run on wood, wood pellets, charcoal, or gas from a canister. It can churn out authentic Neapolitan-style pizzas in 60 to 90 sec.
pros: Easy to set up and pack away
you can make pizza at a friend's house or on the beach

customer_reviews.title: We love our outdoor pizza oven!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, great quality, outdoor pizza oven that cooks pizzas to perfection. I like that you can use charcoal or wood/pellets. We also use the oven for a lot more than just pizzas, super fun to use. I really like the look of it as well, sharp design and extremely portable, very lightweight. A great buy - I would HIGHLY recommend! We enjoy cooking pizzas with the entire family - And the kids love the pizza!
customer_reviews.author: John Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Great oven, better company!!!
customer_reviews.text: As with anything it’s up to the end user to really learn how to use it, but all in all my first pizza out of this thing was amazing. The key is balancing out flame size/soot production and make sure you get the stone hot enough to get it right. BUY AN INFRARED THERMOMETER!!! You absolutely want to know temps throughout the stone and there is no alternative to an infrared thermometer so it’s a must have. Plus their customer service is top notch. I had one small issue and they got back to me and handled immediately. Great oven, better company.
customer_reviews.author: Zenitram

customer_reviews.title: Great, Versatile Pizza Oven!!
customer_reviews.text: I sold my Uuni 3 to get the Napoli Pizza Oven and I’m extremely happy. The Uuni 3 was limited to pellets only and what I love about the Napoli Oven is that I can use charcoal, pellets or pieces of natural wood/chunks. I'm also very impressed with the build quality of this oven and have made some great tasting wood fired pizzas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and efficient.  Makes tasty treats.  Clean function and form.
customer_reviews.text: I got this a few weeks ago. Used it a couple of times now for wings, steak, shrimp, and of course pizza. My kids love it too. Fun and easy to use. Most importantly cooks wonderfully and is priced right. Glad I didn't spend more for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction, great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this oven. Have owned uuni pro and others but this one is the most sturdy. Was having issues with the stone and the company quickly sent me a new one and expedited shipping. Can’t say enough good things and will be gifting this to friends and relatives!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Saardi

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t work. I’ve done 6 trial runs with charcoal and the gas insert. It doesn’t matter. Doesn’t get hot enough at the opening to cook crust on that half at all. Burns the part nearest the heat source. It’s tiny so there’s no room to maneuver a peel in there to turn it. This is junk. Save your money and go out for good pizza!!
customer_reviews.author: Montster70

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pizza oven for my kids. Have attempted to use the oven multiple times, different dough thickness, different dough makeup. Have tried wood chips and purchased the propane attachment. Attempted to speak with the seller and get cooking ideas. End result, burnt edges, sloppy cheese and raw under dough. Also, the stone cracked and is now broken in half after the ninth use. Take your money elsewhere, maybe just order out because with the money you will waste buying this item, you will not get any edible returns
customer_reviews.author: roy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money or trouble
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t get hot enough. Tried 2 different fuels (coal and wood pellets) doesn’t get anywhere near hot enough to cook on. Used 1/4 of a dough from pizzeria and didn’t cook thru after 30 minutes. Much better off just putting a pizza stone on top of gas grill and cooking that way.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little pizza oven
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I have been looking for, a versatile portable wood burning pizza oven. It’s very well designed and made, and at an affordable price. Have used with pellets so far but buying the gas burner accessory for added convenience. Thoroughly recommend. These guys have produced a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY THE WORST PURCHASE I HAVE EVER MADE! Gave it 3 tries and it is awful. Stone does not get hot enough, black soot/smoke pours out non stop. Do not waste 300 dollars on this piece of crap!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick C

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time or efforts
customer_reviews.text: Product came defective. Powder coating /paint near front opening has a major manufacturing defect. Using this with wood, pellets, charcoal is nearly impossible to regulate temperature without some type of external fan.. Even with a fan, it is a joke.The gas attachemnt is $80. If included it might be a mediocre product. Without, it is not practically functional. Do not waste your time and frustration on this piece of junk. Just another piece of Chinese junk they are misleading people on. Forgot to add, they will have no communication with you after they get your money. Stay as far away a you can
customer_reviews.author: Scott E.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you give it plenty of time to warm up the stone, takes a little practice to get the dough full cooked, but that's not an oven default. Customer service is great. Wood chunks have worked the best so far, be careful not to put to much wood initially as the flames can vent out the back and burn the wood handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Napoli Pizza Oven: Best Value and Range of Fuel Options!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Napoli Pizza Oven for about 3 months now and have loved it! I've followed the outdoor pizza oven scene for a while now and came very close to buying from a competitor out of Europe.....but once I saw the Napoli in action on Kickstarter than I knew it was the one for me! For the price and range of fuel options (wood, charcoal, wood pellets, and gas) I really feel like it's a great product! It can take a few tries to get the technique down but there is a fantastic community on FB for help and the customer support has been great too!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hubble Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful oven
customer_reviews.text: This outdoor oven worked so well that I purchased a second one for our summer cabin. Compared to the other ovens on the market, the Napoli oven resulted in outstanding oven temperatures and I experimented cooking various other foods in the oven and was NEVER disappointed. The quality of this oven compared with others sold in the marketplace was unparalleled. I have recommended this oven to other friends who enjoy outdoor cooking and they have had very similar results. Kudos to the inventor and keep up those online recipes provided you and others for us to enjoy! If I could give this product 6 stars instead of 5, I would!!!
customer_reviews.author: mary bert

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Sent this back. Didn’t keep a steady temperature. For the price, I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: April Schack

customer_reviews.title: will not get hot
customer_reviews.text: it will not hot until you make close the front opening . so to the company i hope you guys make a cover to close the front. then i will buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Jam Jam

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t get anywhere near 900 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I am have made several pizzas and cannot get the crust crisp ... it’s mushy. I decided to purchase a infrared thermometer and after 45 minutes at high propane heat the temp is only at 550 f. I am frustrated with this oven I so wanted it to work well! I may have to send the oven and the propane attachment back!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: The pizza tastes good but it's more of a project than I planned on.
customer_reviews.text: The oven arrived in perfect condition and was simple to get ready. There not much documentation on using the oven but i did find some useful you tube videos. This was a Christmas present and so far has only been used once. You really do have to plan on 90 minutes to get it up to temperature and even then the crust wasn't as crispy as I'd hoped. More work to be done there. I think this will be more of an event gadget than an everyday option; fun for a pizza party gathering but not for dinner after work.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Pizza perfetto Grazie Napoli
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the oven without the Propane burner. Burning wood pellets and coals takes lots of patients and trying to keep a consistent temp takes skill. Especially when cooking multiple pizzas. So we sprang for the propane burner , wow a game changer excellent pizzas and consistent temps . Also purchased the wood pellets attachment for propane burner still have to test it out. Very satisfied with the oven. Wish they would make a outdoor cover that will cover the whole oven with the Propane attached. Grazie Mille
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pizza oven, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this pizza oven, it's my first so I don't have anything to compare it too but it's great. Ordered the propane gas attachment and it's really easy to use. Next I'm going to try wood pellets and wood chunks. Based on all the other videos I've watched and based on price point. I believe this is the best pizza oven for the money, actually probably the best for even twice the price. Great job Napoli !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthtomas

customer_reviews.title: pizza stone arrived cracked and unusable
customer_reviews.text: 1 star review is because pizza stone arrived cracked and unusable. I have called bertello 2 times and have not heard back yet. I will update stars given when they fix problem. It is not hard to use if you read the reviews and watch a youtube how to video. I made 4 pizzas so far with all tasting amazing. Get a good peel. I found that getting it up past 650 degrees requires a small fan in the back (any type of fan) to feed air into the fire box. After that, things were easy and manageable. The pizza tasted amazing, kids really enjoyed it. Really cheap packaging, maybe that's why it came broken to me
customer_reviews.author: S. Mon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: We used it on Mother’s Day weekend. We had a family camping cook off. We had a Ton of fun. A lot of family bonding and the pizzas came out really good for a whole bunch of beginners.
customer_reviews.author: chris Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was so very excited for this oven. We read every review and tip and thought for sure we’d have delicious pizza. After 6 hours of attempts, several types of wood chips, we knew the pizza wouldn’t stop tasting of chemicals and moved to the oven. Thoroughly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this, but...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been making pizza for years. I bought this oven with high hopes and really wanted to love this oven. After having used it several times, I’m a bit disappointed. The pizza is never cooked through, always has seriously charred taste and the crust is consistently burned to hell. Maybe I’m doing something wrong, but having a lot of experience making pizza, I don’t see it. I have not used the gas attachment...maybe that’s it. In any event, beware before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KRAMER

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to buy multiple pizza stones at $34.99 each!
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice - worked well once you get the hang of turning the pizza every 20 seconds. But, don’t try to wipe or clean the pizza stone (cold) before you use it! It cracks easily and is really thin: only a 1/2 inch! With a broken pizza stone and tons of dough, I had to use my electric oven with a more reliable 3/4 inch cordierite stone that’s never cracked in 6 years. Wish I could find another brand of 3/4 inch cordierite that would fit the odd size of 12.5”x13.5”, but now expecting to buy a new $34.99 stone every time I need to make a pizza in the Bertello Oven. Be ready to spend more money!
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Awesome oven
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this pizza oven!!! I did a lot of research and ended up with this because of its ease of transport and size. My only complaint is that it’s very tough to get a real crispy bottom crust. Otherwise it’s amazing, it’s quick, easy to regulate and makes a ton of great pizzas one after the other. Great for parties. We are addicted to using it and would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We Dig It!
customer_reviews.text: I'm lovin it. My advise: - Get surface temp gauge to track the stone; - Pellets suck and don't work by themselves; - Get the propane attachment and the wood tray. Your temps won't swing so much and no small fire to tend; - Have two peels. One to make and the other to load/turn It's not that hard. My first one was perfect (with only wood at that time). They have only gotten better.
customer_reviews.author: HoosierD

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it will last.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so the oven itself works great. Pizza in about a minute. Easy to put together. I purchased the propane attachment. Again worked as it’s supposed to. Not sure how long the outer finish on the oven will last though. I used this oven twice. Total time turned on was about 1.5 hours. As you can see in the picture the heat definitely effects the outer finish. Starting to rust already. I did leave it outside for 2 nights. Not in the rain. This is what i was hoping it didn’t do. I Thought i did enough research. Hoping i won’t regret buying this. I will update if it gets worse.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Cristy Schaaf

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing uneven heat
customer_reviews.text: You can get this hot enough with wood or charcoal, and when using gas burner I couldn't get enough heat under the stone to cook the crust without burning the top. Very uneven heat.
customer_reviews.author: M. Slick

customer_reviews.title: Read ALL reviews not just the good ones which are paid for
customer_reviews.text: I am convinced most reviews on here are paid for because I have tried this over and over and have lots of experience using high temp heat like the green egg. It’s cheap thin metal. It burns the pizza and sticks to the bottom. It’s impossible to move every 30 seconds and not ruin your pizza. I have wasted close to $400 on this thing including accessories, fan, etc. You will be disappointed I promise.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Fellers

customer_reviews.title: Save your money folks...
customer_reviews.text: This is a waste of time and money... Impossible to maintain the correct heat... hot in the rear cold in the front... needs constant attention to maintain any heat whatsoever... bought this for my kids and grandchildren to enjoy "Friday night pizza" but in 6 months we have NEVER been able to make an edible pizza pie...
customer_reviews.author: Bazmon

customer_reviews.title: I like it and it's pretty self explanatory - makes great pizzas!
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat little pizza oven. I made 3 pizzas in it shortly after I got it and it definitely seems like it is going to be a learning curve. I tried using pellets the first time but I found they smoked a lot and burned very quickly so the fire went out between two pizzas. It seems to be very similar to the Ooni but a better price at the time I purchased. I think ultimately I may get the gas add on to do gas & wood for more consistent cooking. They also have a Napoli FB group where you can get great help and advice from others who have this oven.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin George

customer_reviews.title: Arrived BROKEN!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm sure it's great. But I wouldn't buy one of these unless you have dealer support. Mine arrived with a broken stone, so it's wortless. Calling the number in the owner's manual isn't going to get you anywhere but a voice mail box. I would AVOID THIS ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: F. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ‘game changer’ for cooking
customer_reviews.text: I’ve really enjoyed using this oven. The oven has a really solid build and the wood fired pizzas have turned out amazing! I’ve also tried a cast iron skillet and have cooked some really good meat and fish. This is an item I will use for many years to come to impress my friends, and making special dishes for my family with quickness and ease.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K. Schaff

customer_reviews.title: Wood, gas or both and all that in a portable oven! The best you can ask for!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking long time for small, portable wood fired pizza oven and was going for the Ooni until I saw this one. Believe me, you will not regret it! Very easy to use and fires up to 700-800F. I used it only for sourdough neapolitan pizza so far and is perfect! I tried wood chunks, pellets and gas. Wood only is great but it takes longer to heat up the stone properly. With the gas burner you have the best of both worlds. It heats up much faster, easy to maintain the temperature and the great taste of the wood!
customer_reviews.author: Emilia

customer_reviews.title: good pizza oven but...
customer_reviews.text: smaller than I thought although big enough. Also does not get hot enough without assistance. I found that I had to pour in hot charcoal from a charcoal chimney and use a fan as a billow to get the heat up enough and then it is hard to keep it hot enough while the stone heats up and you cook a few pizzas. it takes work but will make great pizza when you figure it out. It also started to rust after it got some rain water on it.
customer_reviews.author: J wil

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Really love this oven. My kids love pizza, and making pizza together outside is a great family activity. We bought the gas attachment as well, which really makes for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: NCM

customer_reviews.title: Napoli brings the HEAT!
customer_reviews.text: Love this oven! Our Napoli shipped quick via PRIME and couldn't have been easier to set up and get fired up. Propane hook-up makes it easy and can't wait to try adding some wood chips during future cooks for extra flavor. Pizzas are awesome on this thing and looking forward to trying wings and steaks. Live in a condo and room on the deck is a premium which makes the Napoli that much better an option for us.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Good pizza oven with some technical issues to solve. For the price I think it’s the best available.
customer_reviews.text: The unit was not shipped and the reimbursement covered only 2/3 of the amount paid. I was unable to get the full reimbursement. Since I had already received the gas burner , I reordered the oven and got it promptly. Assembly was easy. The reviews mentioned it took 10-15 minutes to warm up the oven using an infrared thermometer . Actually it took much longer to warm up the stone. Once it’s fired up though, the pizza cooking was up to snuff after working through minor but unavoidable technical issues.
customer_reviews.author: michel laurin

customer_reviews.title: Great product, surprisingly great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The original shipment came with a broken pizza stone. We contacted the manufacturer via email, received very fast reply, and they shipped us a new stone no questions asked. Out of the box, first time firing it was easy and got up to 800+degrees in 15min. I’m looking forward to trying different recipes and tweaking my cooking styles.
customer_reviews.author: JFed

customer_reviews.title: Great pizza oven
customer_reviews.text: This pizza oven is great. The pizza comes out nice after only few minutes though you really have to pay attention to it and rotate the pizza pie every 30-40 seconds. make sure the burner is on low when the pizza stone reaches the high temperature point. An infrared thermometer really helps. I put the pizza oven with the legs extended on top of the side of my grill. It fits nicely and it stays stable.
customer_reviews.author: Nourdine C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great pizza on first try
customer_reviews.text: The Napoli Wood Fire oven is great and easy to use. I was able to make delicious pizza on my first attempt. The oven heats up quite quickly and I was able to make pizzas in just a couple minutes each. I would definitely recommend a wide spatula for placing and removing the pizzas as well as rotating them while they cook. I have used with wood and the propane adapter and both worked great. I love how easy it is to get going using the propane and have experimented with adding wood to the propane as well.
customer_reviews.author: Byurinich

customer_reviews.title: Great for Napoli style
customer_reviews.text: This product reaches temp quickly and cooks pizzas perfectly, if you have experience with multi-direction heat source cooking. You will need a pizza peel to rotate larger pies during cooking to avoid burning. Overall, this is a well designed and great oven for small Napoli style pizzas. It does not work well for "American" style pizzas that require lower temp cooking for long periods. Kitchen ovens work much better because they provide a more even heat source.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Harris, third generation cheapskate

customer_reviews.title: Turn it once or twice and it will be good
customer_reviews.text: Ok I love this little thing . Now I know I can lift out the pizza stone whilst it’s hot with my utensil I am much better at using it . The first few were a mess but the last one was almost perfect . The heat does generally come from the back though so you do have to turn it half way through . Totally worth the money and I’d recommend it to anyone who loves pizza and the out doors . My boyfriend said it was the best pizza he had had all year. .
customer_reviews.author: joscelyn stoker

customer_reviews.title: She’s a beaut, Clark.
customer_reviews.text: I very much love this oven. Bought it for boyf’s birthday and he’s ecstatic. We’ve used it 3 times including a small, 10 person party and it was amazing. We’re still working on figuring out temperature and how to assemble in the best order, but it’s so much fun. I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Snyder

customer_reviews.title: broken stone upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: I received my Napoli pizza oven today and the baking stone was in three pieces. Not useable at this time. I have written and left a message at Napoli and am awaiting their response. I will update my info as soon as they respond.
customer_reviews.author: MAUD K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pizzas!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our new Napoli Pizza Oven. We brought it to our cabin and made pizzas by the water. It was like being in paradise. The oven is so portable and easy to use. AND the pizzas were delicious--everyone in our family loved them--our kids, our parents, and us. It will get a lot of use. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: Rae Brovi

customer_reviews.title: Still experimenting
customer_reviews.text: Wish the heat distributed more evenly and/or was slightly deeper/taller. The side of the pizza closest to the fire burns quickly, and needs to be rotated for even cooking. We’re still experimenting at getting a high quality home pizza, but it’s an expensive experiment kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Five Star Pizza Oven
customer_reviews.text: I love my pizza oven!! We use it all of the time for pizza parties by the pool. The duel fuel option is excellent for getting the oven screaming hot and the wood chips for flavor. I’ve experimented with different dough recipes and found that a drier dough works best. Also, using half bread flour and half 00 flour produces a great crust. I would highly recommend (and have) the Napoli to anyone searching for a pizza oven!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken pizza stone
customer_reviews.text: We were disappointed that the pizza stone came broken. We were counting on using this pizza oven for a birthday and we don't have time to return the entire set and wait for a replacement so we have do just order another stone for $35.
customer_reviews.author: Cody washburn

customer_reviews.title: Great Pizza Oven
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy oven, arrived in great shape due to careful packaging and due to its being mostly one piece. Assembly is very simple, since the few loose pieces are accessories. Gets blazing hot, which is precisely what’s needed for a pizza oven.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great value with portability
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I were thinking about building another pizza oven, we built a large one at out cabin. She went online and found the Napoli. The cost was so much less than the material cost, let alone the labor involved in building one. With some skepticism I ordered the Napoli. It has far exceeded my expectations. Wonderful pizza with that smokey touch that a wood fired oven gives. And you can take the oven with you. Like any wood fired oven, you must keep an eye on your product turning it as needed. No disappointments just delicious pizza.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Such a GREAT gift!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gift for my husband's birthday and it was a HUGE hit! We used it at our small birthday party with friends and family and EVERYONE was impressed. It was easy to assemble, heated up quickly and stayed hot with only one charcoal refresh, and the pizza tasted GREAT!!! I purchased this one over others because the legs fold in, there is no chimney, and it is easy to store without taking up too much space. I have nothing bad to say about our experience with the pizza oven and we can't wait to use it again this weekend :) Thanks for such a kick-ass product!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great oven,  need experience
customer_reviews.text: I need to learn a lot more about making pizza to use this oven. Using a small diameter crust (about 10") it worked great. It easily heated to >900 degrees F and made a wonderful crust. Unfortunately when I used the tools I had to make a larger crust, they were not up to the task. This is an amazing oven but at the amateur level I am, I need more experience.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: broken stone
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this 2 times only to have the stone broken both times at arrival and had to return it. We gave up on the product!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Arrived dented but excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with a dent and chipped paint spot about the size of a quarter. Its on the front panel so obvious. Product box was damaged but Amazon box was fine so it was shipped damaged. Everything else looks fine. On Bertello’s website, they have a package price with a cover, thermometer and spatula. I wish I would have seen that option. As a follow-up, their customer service is awesome. Quick to respond and resolve. I’ve been using the oven for awhile now and it’s fabulous. Pizzas are great!!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great Versatile Pizza Oven
customer_reviews.text: Love the oven. With the propane attachment it easily reaches the desired temps of 900+ degrees. It is very functional with just wood as well but requires a bit more attention. With careful monitoring (because of the heat) pizzas turn out great. The family used to complain when I made pizza (they wanted it from the pizzeria) but now they beg me to make my own. Also, the customer service from Bertello (formerly Napoli) is fantastic; any questions or concerns are usually answered within a day. The group on Facebook is similarly responsive. Really enjoying what I am able to do with this oven.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to your temperature and timer
customer_reviews.text: Wood fire pizza ovens do take getting used to. This is a lovely product, dont get distracted, watch your temperature and time carefully. We had great fun whipping up pizzas for our friends. Or just for dinner on a nice night.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Pizzareia-style Pizza Right at Home
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, awesome flavor and look to pizza. Glad I made this purchase. The company is also wonderful - great customer service. Just wish it was a little bigger - bigger is always better
customer_reviews.author: Mary C

customer_reviews.title: Love this portable oven! Very versatile fuel options.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to verify the high temperature claims with an infared temp sensor, really hot! We are excited to be making personal size pizzas and especially to having our grandkids choose their own toppings. Our challenge now is to learn how to make the dough to our liking! There was a minor issue with the propane burner that the Bertello staff solved very quickly. Great oven!
customer_reviews.author: Jane M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great flavorful food
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality, ease of use the best size ever. I have a small outdoor patio to cook on and have been amazed at how easy and quickly the Napoli is able to create a great meal. We've been experimenting with different crusts and vegetables on the pizza and have made each meal fun. I highly recommend this product for everyone that enjoys economy, convenience and great food. Well worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Brad J Wolfer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use , makes great pizza
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this pizza oven , have only had it a week , it was worth the wait ... My children love it (ages 18,21,23) . I can make so many different options that one cannot get at your local pizza shop. The customer service is awesome (Thank You Eric) I am recommending it to everyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gas conversion kit is key
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an outdoor pizza oven that won't break the bank and gets up to the high temps needed to cook authentic Neapolitan pizza, this one gets the job done. I highly recommend getting the gas conversion kit; much more consistent and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real Italian pizza baked at home!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always loved pizza my whole life. I come from the east coast where getting a good slice is really easy, but when I moved to Colorado where it became a lot harder, and then I found the bertello pizza oven! We have pizza nights with friends all the time and everyone is always so impressed with the pizza. Three of my friends ended up getting their own! If your thinking about getting one, then go for it! Great costumer service & product. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: paul r.

customer_reviews.title: Second one is good....
customer_reviews.text: First one ordered was tampered with and damaged! Not an easy package to return! I wish Amazon would check orders before sent out! Second one ordered was fine......pizza was yummy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
